The strengths of this class lie in its strong connection with clinical knowledge, could be a good fit for students to learn how to build the bridge between public health and medical research.
This was a terrific course, my only recommendation would be to include even more clinical-related aspects.
This was a great course! I enjoyed the format, the workload was fair, and the guest speakers were all excellent.
Amazing class.
It's interactive and discussion based
very good

I liked all the assignments and feel like they supplemented the material well. Although I do think the shark tank assignment could have been formally assigned earlier in the semester. I liked having speakers come in to share their knowledge but also their personal experiences with us. I would not make any major changes to the course. Perhaps capping the size to increase participation from everyone. Or also having a more engaged TF could have maybe helped to better understand the topics.
Professor Lichtman has rich experience in teaching and research. This course offers us insight into health outcome research in cardiovascular and stroke.
Professor Lichtman brought an extremely high level of experience and expertise to the topics covered in this course.
Dr. Lichtman is wonderful! Very knowledgeable and really cares about her students. She is a gem of YSPH!
An incredible instructor.
A fantastic embodiment of interdisciplinary and intersectional public health.
She is attentive and facilitates discussion well
her lecture was  very involving and informative

The professor was willing to actively adjust the syllabus to the interests and current projects of students which made the material applicable and not just theoretical. She was supportive of the engagement of each individual student in discussion and facilitated topics well to ensure comments from students and her own built on previous comments and did not repeat them. The degree of her knowledge on the topic motivated me to actively work to understand the material too and generally held us as a group accountable.
Worth taking if you are interested in cardio&stroke field
I would certainly recommend this course to a fellow student as it covered many topics regarding heart disease and stroke rarely discussed in comparable courses.
Every CDE student should be required to this class. Wonderful professor and highly important course content.
It's a good introductory class to cardiovascular health
great

I would genuinely recommend this course to other students. It was accessible regardless of the department of a student and offered a different perspective to epidemiology from other courses offered. The topics ranged widely but were always covered by the readings and lecture well.
